balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}.     * Requirements:     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}.     * Requirements:     * - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params._index: is LL index in nested mapping

returns._0: the Linked List Node last pointer
returns._1: the Linked List Node next pointer
returns._2: the IOU struct Loan ID value
returns._4: the IOU struct timestamp for staking in that order

params._id: is the ID of the loan you're minting
params._paymentContractAddress: is the address of the loan's contract. "Borrower" in this

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

params._index: is the index in the linked list mentioned above with state varaibles

returns._0: if successful. May not be if loan has been completed since staking

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}.     * This implementation returns the same URI for *all* token types. It relies on the token type ID substitution mechanism https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata[defined in the EIP].     * Clients calling this function must replace the `\{id\}` substring with the actual token type ID.

getAccruances(address,uint256).notice: function get's how many accruance periods a person has staked through

getStakingAt(address,uint256).notice: Staking mapping is no longer public. Must call this to get staking info

newLoan(address,uint256).notice: function creates the tokens for a new loan so they can be sold to generate funding

stake(uint256,uint256).notice: function stakes an ammount of ERC-1155's with id from sender. MUST Approve contract first

userdoc.notice: Bonds mints ERC1155 tokens that represent ownership of a loan specified by a Payment Contract. These bonds can accrue interest and be exchanged for payments made in the payment contract
